newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Wood Gundy to buy Australian broker-sources.
newsitem.headline: Wood Gundy to buy Australian broker-sources.

text.p: Canadian-based financial services group CIBC Wood Gundy, a unit of the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce, was set to announce the acquisition of Perth-based stockbroker Eyres Reed Ltd, industry sources told Reuters on Monday.
One source said a news conference was scheduled for Friday in Sydney, where the purchase would be confirmed.
Speculation surfaced some weeks ago that CIBC Wood Gundy had been doing due diligence on the Perth broker.
A spokesman for Eyres Reed declined to comment while stock brokers were reluctant to speculate on the price that could be paid.

Fellow broker Hartley Poynton, the only listed stockbroker on the Australian Stock Exchange, is capitalised at about A$50 million, while discount broker Pont Securities Ltd was bought by a Toronto-Dominion Bank unit for A$30 million in May 1997.
Late in 1996, giant U.S. financial services group Merrill Lynch and Co Inc paid A$117 million for the then-listed McIntosh Securities.
